item.title: Debris on cycle lane., 25th November
item.description:
New cycle way unusable as a lot of debris from main road and hedges has accumulated along it's length making it a puncture risk if used. Also standing water when it has rained lots.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bridleway overgrown by brambles and nettles. Very narrow. Branch over path at about 4 ft height. Impassable on horse or bike, 25th November
item.description:
Bridleway from far Stanley to top of hill is very narrow due to overgrown brambles and nettles and fallen branches, and very muddy. Dangerous to walk down and impassable on horse or bike

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 24th November
item.description:
FMS Report has been made to Gloucestershire Police (incident 264 20-11-2023) - a male has driven into the pedestrian crossing signal. Please see attached photo. Please advise how you wish to proceed with this report and whether you are wishing to proceed with a formal Police investigation into this matter. If you can update soonest via 101 if you wish to proceed with any complaint. Our log will be closed pending any further contact from yourselves. Many Thanks
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Road closed sign left on pavement, 24th November
item.description:
The road was closed for roadworks several months ago, and there's still a road closed sign left behind. It keeps being moved by students and messed around with. But ultimately, it's now just 'rubbish' that's blocking the view round the corner when driving.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 159, Brunswick Street, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gate is damaged/missing/locked problem, 24th November
item.description:
email rec 22/11/2023 Please see attached a map of the footpaths near to Whittington Court, GL54 4HF. We are re-fencing a section near to the footpath and would like to add a new kissing gate (site marked with a purple cross) where the footpath crosses the new stock fence. Do you supply these gates?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 24th November
item.description:
I'm hoping to place a charity banner on railings in Cheltenham and understand I need to seek your permission. The attachment includes all the details and I hope this is the right route to seek that agreement. This is my first time seeking permission for such a banner so any advice would be welcomed.
Report on FixMyStreet
